intro: Lomaria arborescens, commonly known as the tree lomaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
